info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 07 at 9:09PM PDT until August 09 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM MONDAY TO 9 PM PDT TUESDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR NORTHERN AND EASTERN PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 624... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR SOUTHWESTERN PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * Impacts: In southwestern zone 624, strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread potential of any new and existing fires. In northern and eastern zone 624, Lightning and high fire danger will likely result in new fire starts. Gusty thunderstorm winds could contribute to fire spread. Despite rainfall, initial attack resources could be overwhelmed and holdover fires are possible. * Affected area: The Red Flag Warning for abundant lightning on dry fuels covers northern and eastern portions of Fire Weather Zone 624, mainly east and north of Chiloquin, including Chemult, Beatty, and Bly. The Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low RH covers southwestern Fire Weather Zone 624, including Keno, Worden, and Klamath Falls. * Wind: South 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * Humidity: As low as 10 percent. * Thunderstorms: Thunderstorm activity will likely begin by mid- afternoon Monday with the most active period likely in the late afternoon and evening. Activity could linger at night and into Tuesday, shifting east and north with time. Storms will also become wetter by Tuesday. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD Precautionary/preparedness actions... If you have not packed your evacuation kit yet, now is the time to do so. This includes items like important documents and essentials you cannot live without. Fill your vehicle`s fuel tank. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Plan now to avoid using equipment that could cause sparks during the period when critical weather conditions are possible. Visit weather.gov/medford/wildfire for links to fire restrictions in your area. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning. &&
